page.title: 06THE HAXEY HOOD GAME
page.content: Sometime in the 12th century,Lady De Mowbray was on horseback,going home from the church,when a gust of wind blew her black silk hood off of her head. 13 workmen,who were in a field nearby,saw her hood fly off and started to scramble for it.After some time fighting for it,the srongest of the men came out with the hood.But he was too shy to give it back to Lady De Mowbray,so he gave it to another man, and that man gave it to the Lady. Lady De Mowbray giggled and said the strong man had been a Fool,and the man who gave her hood back was a Lord.She said that she wanted the game to carry on and to be held each 6th of January.She called all the other men Boggins,because they had been bogged into the ground.
